section.title: Default
section.description: Specify the default layout style for this component.

section.title: Style type
section.description: Style type property

section.title: Class map
section.description: Specify how the abstract CSS class names used in this component map to physical CSS class names in your style sheets.

section.title: Resolve class map at runtime
section.description: To optimize performance, the class map is resolved a design time. If you check this property you can dynamically change the appearance of the component at runtime by remapping all of the abstract classes used in the component to a different set of physical CSS class names.

section.title: Style name
section.description: Click the button to select a new style, or edit the existing style. IMPORTANT If any of the Grids shown in the TabbedUI use a different style than this style, their styles must be listed in the 'Additional Grid styles' section below. You can also use or (V11 and above)

section.title: Style overrides
section.description: By default, the Tabs, Accordions, pop-up Windows, Lists (edit-combo, auto-suggest, etc.) are style using the selected Grid style. You can override the style for these elements. This might be necessary for certain styles where the default appearance for these elements do not work well.

section.title: Font size
section.description: Specify if the fonts in Grid Components should be scaled to make the Grid larger or smaller. Select 'Medium' for no scaling (i.e. the fonts shown will match those defined in the style sheet).

section.title: Minimum height
section.description: Specify the minimum height (in pixels) for the 'Content Area' (from below the 'Header' to above the 'Footer').

section.title: Master template
section.description: Specify an optional Master Template. This allows you to place arbitrary HTML surrounding the Tabbed UI component.

section.title: Center TabbedUI on page
section.description: Specify if the Tabbed UI component should be a fixed width and centered horizontally on the page. (This property is only shown if you have not defined a Master Template.)

section.title: Component width
section.description: Specify the width of the Tabbed UI component. Use CSS units.

section.title: Component border class name
section.description: Specify the class name for the border that surrounds the Tabbed UI component.

section.title: Component border in-line style
section.description: Specify the in-line style for the border that surrounds the Tabbed UI component.

section.title: Header text
section.description: Specify the HTML text for the header section. This appears above the tab panes. TIP: The HTML can include <%a5...%> Xbasic code blocks.

section.title: Footer text
section.description: Specify the HTML text for the footer section. This appears at the bottom of the page. TIP: The HTML can include <%a5...%> Xbasic code blocks.

section.title: Page title
section.description: Specify the page title for the .a5w page that will display the Tabbed User Interface.

section.title: Layout mode (Desktop or Mobile)
section.description: Should the layout of the Tabbed UI component be optimized for a Desktop Browser, or a mobile device (phone or tablet)?

section.title: Hide tab buttons
section.description: Should the tab pane buttons be hidden? If yes, then the only way to switch from one open tab to another is by clicking on a button in the Buttons Pane.

section.title: Mobile layout 'Menu' button text
section.description: Specify the text for the button that shows the Tabbed UI menu choices.

section.title: Mobile layout 'Menu' title text
section.description: Specify the text that appears in the title bar when the menu buttons are displayed.

section.title: Display Home page initially
section.description: When the Tabbed UI Object is initially opened, should the Home Page be shown? If you uncheck this, then the Tabbed UI Menu Buttons pane is shown.

section.title: Buttons panel location
section.description: Specify where the Button Panel (which contains the buttons to open the pages that are shown in the Tabbed User Interface) is located.

section.title: Buttons panel style
section.description: The Button Panel is contained in a TD tag. Specify the style for the tag. You can specify the width of the Button Panel in the style. IMPORTANT: Do NOT specify a height for this Button Panel. The height of this section is automatically computed by the component.

section.title: Buttons - padding left
section.description: Specify the padding on the left side of the buttons. (Setting is ignored if Button Panel is on right).

section.title: Buttons - padding right
section.description: Specify the padding on the right side of the buttons. (Setting is ignored if Button Panel is on left).

section.title: Buttons - padding top
section.description: Specify the padding above the buttons.

section.title: Set button padding off if using Tree Control
section.description: If the Tabbed UI buttons are in a Tree Control should the button padding be set to 0? (Tree looks better when padding is set to 0).

section.title: Prompt when navigate away from page
section.description: When user navigates from the page that contains the Tabbed UI component, should a confirmation message be displayed?

section.title: Navigation confirmation message (dirty Grids)
section.description: NOT SUPPORTEC Specify the syntax of the warning message that is displayed when the user tries to navigate from the page that contains the Tabbed UI. This message is only displayed if any of the panes that contain Grid components are 'dirty'.

section.title: Navigation confirmation (no dirty Grids)
section.description: NOT SUPPORTED Specify the message to display when the user tries to navigate from the page th at contains the Tabbed UI Component (and there are no Grids with unsaved data).

section.title: Tab close image
section.description: Specify the image for the close tab button. Specify or blank to use the default image. In V11 and above indicates that the image is defined in the style. By editing the style you can change the image.

section.title: Tab close image (on hover)
section.description: Specify the image to display when the user is hovering over the close tab button. Specify or blank to use the default image. In V11 and above indicates that the image is defined in the style. By editing the style you can change the image.

section.title: Tab scroll - previous image
section.description: If there are more tabs open that can be displayed, the tab band will scroll. Specify the image for the scroll left button. Specify or blank to use the default image. In V11 and above indicates that the image is defined in the style. By editing the style you can change the image.

section.title: Tab scroll - previous disabled image
section.description: Specify the scroll previous image when the button is disabled. Specify or blank to use the default image. In V11 and above indicates that the image is defined in the style. By editing the style you can change the image.

section.title: Tab scroll - next image
section.description: If there are more tabs open that can be displayed, the tab band will scroll. Specify the image for the scroll right button. Specify or blank to use the default image. In V11 and above indicates that the image is defined in the style. By editing the style you can change the image.

section.title: Tab scroll - next disabled image
section.description: Specify the scroll next image when the button is disabled. Specify or blank to use the default image. In V11 and above indicates that the image is defined in the style. By editing the style you can change the image.

section.title: Collapse button bar icon (Left)
section.description: Specify the icon to collapse the button panel. Set to , or blank, to use the icon specified in the style.

section.title: Expand button bar icon (Left)
section.description: Specify the icon to expand the button panel after it has been collapsed. Set to , or blank, to use the icon specified in the style.

section.title: Collapse button bar icon (Right)
section.description: Specify the icon to collapse the button panel. Set to , or blank, to use the icon specified in the style.

section.title: Expand button bar icon (Right)
section.description: Specify the icon to expand the button panel after it has been collapsed. Set to , or blank, to use the icon specified in the style.

section.title: Can collapse buttons pane
section.description: Specify if the button pane can be collapsed.

section.title: Initial state of buttons pane
section.description: Specify the initial state of the Buttons pane. 'Open' - button pane is shown, 'Closed' - button pane is not shown, but the user can click the expand button to show the button pane, 'Closed-locked' - button pane is not shown - the button pane can only be shown programatically using this Javascript command: tbiObj.showTabbedUIMenuPanel(flagShowAnimation);

section.title: Auto hide buttons pane
section.description: Specify if the buttons pane should be automatically hidden after the user moves the mouse out of the buttons pane area.

section.title: Auto hide delay
section.description: Specify the delay in milliseconds before the button pane is automatically hidden/shown.

section.title: Permanently hide buttons pane
section.description: Specify if the buttons pane should be permanently eliminated from the Tabbed UI. If you choose this option, then you must set then 'Auto launch on startup' property for the objects that you want to see in the Tabbed UI. You should also uncheck the 'Can close pane' property for each object, or else, if the user closes a pane, there will be no way to re-open the pane.

section.title: Tab band
section.description: Specify the class name for the tab band. Specify to use the default class associated with the Tabbed UI style you selected. Tip: You can specify a class to use in ADDITION to the default class by using this syntax: YourClassName

section.title: Tab band separator
section.description: Specify the class name for the tab band separator. Specify to use the default class associated with the Tabbed UI style you selected. Tip: You can specify a class to use in ADDITION to the default class by using this syntax: YourClassName

section.title: Tab button off
section.description: Specify the class name for the tab buttons when not selected. Specify to use the default class associated with the Tabbed UI style you selected. Tip: You can specify a class to use in ADDITION to the default class by using this syntax: YourClassName

section.title: Tab button on
section.description: Specify the class name for tab buttons when selected. Specify to use the default class associated with the Tabbed UI style you selected. Tip: You can specify a class to use in ADDITION to the default class by using this syntax: YourClassName

section.title: Tab button disabled
section.description: Specify the class name for disabled tab buttons. Specify to use the default class associated with the Tabbed UI style you selected. Tip: You can specify a class to use in ADDITION to the default class by using this syntax: YourClassName

section.title: Tab band left scroll
section.description: Specify the class name for the tab band left scroll. Specify to use the default class associated with the Tabbed UI style you selected. Tip: You can specify a class to use in ADDITION to the default class by using this syntax: YourClassName

section.title: Tab band right scroll
section.description: Specify the class name for the tab band right scroll. Specify to use the default class associated with the Tabbed UI style you selected. Tip: You can specify a class to use in ADDITION to the default class by using this syntax: YourClassName

section.title: Tab band left scroll disabled
section.description: Specify the class name for the tab band left scroll when disabled. Specify to use the default class associated with the Tabbed UI style you selected. Tip: You can specify a class to use in ADDITION to the default class by using this syntax: YourClassName

section.title: Tab band right scroll disabled
section.description: Specify the class name for the tab band right scroll when disabled. Specify to use the default class associated with the Tabbed UI style you selected. Tip: You can specify a class to use in ADDITION to the default class by using this syntax: YourClassName

section.title: A5W Page name
section.description: If an .a5w page contains a Tabbed UI Component then that page cannot contain any other component. This is different from other component types. For example, an .a5w page might contain two Grid components. Because .a5w pages that contain Tabbed UI Components are special, they are created automatically for you when the Tabbed UI Component is saved. You can specify the name of the .a5w page that is automatically created or you can let Alpha Five name it for you (the builder will create a page called 'TabbedUI_.a5w').

section.title: User defined 'head' content
section.description: Specify any content you want to place in the 'head' section of the generated .a5w page.

section.title: Noscript Content for Search Engines
section.description: Specify any content that you want to place in the Body section of the page in tags so that Search Engines can index this page.

section.title: Has login/logout links
section.description: If you check this box, a login and logout hyperlink will be displayed in the top right corner of the page. Users will be able to login and logout directly from the Tabbed UI component.

section.title: Login prompt
section.description: Specify the text for the login hyperlink.

section.title: Logout prompt
section.description: Specify the text for the logout hyperlink.

section.title: Customize login failure messages
section.description: Customize login failure messages

section.title: Login action
section.description: When the user logs in specify if a full reload of the page should occur (recommended), or if an Ajax Callback should be performed. Performing an Ajax Callback will be marginally quicker and will result in no screen flicker, but will NOT update any Xbasic code you might be evaluating in the header/footer or home page of the Tabbed UI.

section.title: Has 'Register new account' link
section.description: Specify that a link should be displayed to allow new users to register for an account. This link is only displayed when no one is logged in and will open the component specified in 'Component to display to register new account'. Optionally, it could be used to open any UX component, such as a UX component to change a password.

section.title: Register new account prompt
section.description: Specify the text to show on the 'Register new account' hyperlink.

section.title: New account link location
section.description: Specify where the link to open the 'Register new account' dialog should be shown. It can be on the Menu Bar (next to the Login link), in the Login dialog, or both.

section.title: Component to display to register new account
section.description: Specify the name of the UX component to display where a user can register for a new account.

section.title: Register new account window title
section.description: Specify the title for the window in which the New Account component will be shown.

section.title: Custom menu bar HTML - left
section.description: (Optional) You can specify any text to add to the left side of the menu bar that appear at the top of the Tabbed UI. (This is the menu bar that contains the Login/Logout hyperlinks.)

section.title: Custom menu bar HTML - center
section.description: (Optional) You can specify any text to add in the center of the menu bar that appear at the top of the Tabbed UI. (This is the menu bar that contains the Login/Logout hyperlinks.)

section.title: Logged in message template
section.description: (Optional) You can specify a template to use for the message that is displayed in the menu bar after a user logs in. This message typically indicates the name of the logged in user. The template can include the '{userName}' placeholder for the user name. IMPORTANT: If the server-side 'onLogin' event sets a value for the 'friendly user name', the {username} placeholder will show the friendly user name. For example, the 'friendly user name' for the user 'john23@gmail.com' might be 'John Costansa'.

section.title: Has free-form layout
section.description: Not implemented because we have enough customization options already

section.title: Free-form layout
section.description: Free-form layout property

section.title: Header text
section.description: (Optional) Specify any text you want to appear at the top of the login dialog.

section.title: Footer text
section.description: (Optional) Specify any text you want to appear at the bottom of the login dialog.

section.title: Login button label
section.description: Login button label property

section.title: Login button style
section.description: Login button style property

section.title: Cancel button label
section.description: Cancel button label property

section.title: Cancel button style
section.description: Cancel button style property

section.title: Window width
section.description: Specify the width of the login window. Use CSS units. Leave blank for default size.

section.title: Window height
section.description: Specify the height of the login window. Use CSS units. Leave blank for default size.

section.title: Animate login window
section.description: Animate login window property

section.title: Show window animation method
section.description: Show window animation method property

section.title: Show window animation speed
section.description: Specify speed in milliseconds. You can use 'fast' or 'slow' (fast = 200 ms, slow = 600 ms)

section.title: Hide window animation method
section.description: Hide window animation method property

section.title: Hide window animation speed
section.description: Specify speed in milliseconds. You can use 'fast' or 'slow' (fast = 200 ms, slow = 600 ms)

section.title: Disable auto-complete - User Name field
section.description: Specify if the browser's auto-complete feature should be disabled for the User Name field.

section.title: Disable auto-complete - Password field
section.description: Specify if the browser's auto-complete feature should be disabled for the Password field.

section.title: Display warning before session timeout
section.description: Specify if a warning dialog should be shown in advance of the session timeout. This will allow the user to take an action to extend the session.

section.title: Advance warning timing
section.description: Specify how many minutes in advance of the session timeout the warning should be displayed.

section.title: Check for session timeout every
section.description: Specify how often (in minutes) the check for session timeout should be performed.

section.title: After session timeout action
section.description: After the session has expired what action should be taken. 'Nothing' - keep the warning dialog box visible, but change the message to the session expired message, or 'Redirect to Another Page' - redirect to another page. To redirect back to the Tabbed UI, specify as the target page.

section.title: Target page after session timeout
section.description: Specify the target page after session timeout. Set to to reload the Tabbed UI page.

section.title: Confirmation button Javascript
section.description: After the session has expired, the dialog has an OK button that dismisses the warning dialog. You can optionally specify Javascript to execute when this button is clicked. You can use a special placeholder, '' to automatically generate the Javascript to reload this page.

section.title: Warning message template
section.description: Specify the message template to show in the warning dialog. The template should include the {secondsToSessionEnd} placeholder. This placeholder will display the number of seconds until the session expires.

section.title: Extend session button label
section.description: Extend session button label property

section.title: Warning window title
section.description: Warning window title property

section.title: Session expired message
section.description: Specify the message to show in the message box after the session has expired.

section.title: Button label after session expired
section.description: After the session has expired, the button to 'Extend the session' is no longer valid and is replaced with an OK button that simply dismisses the window. Specify the label for this button.

section.title: Warning window title - after session has expired
section.description: After the session has timed out, specify the text for the warning window title.

section.title: Home page tab title
section.description: Specify the tab title for the Home Page.

section.title: Home page HTML source
section.description: Specify if the HTML that appears on the Home page tab comes from a URL, or is defined locally.

section.title: Home page HTML
section.description: Specify the HTML that appears on the Home Page. TIP: The HTML can include Xbasic code blocks which can reference session variables.

section.title: Home page URL
section.description: Specify the URL for the Home page. You can specify a static HTML document or dynamic .a5w page in your web project, or an external URL. TIP: Certain browsers (e.g. I.E.) might cache the home page. You can force the browser to always load the current version of the home page by including the following two meta tags in the HTML 'head' section:

section.title: Home page auto-refresh
section.description: Specify if the home page should be refreshed every time it gets focus. TIP: Certain browsers (e.g. I.E.) might cache the home page. You can force the browser to always load the current version of the home page by including the following two meta tags in the HTML 'head' section:

section.title: Animate
section.description: Specify if the buttons panel should be animated when it is shown/hidden.

section.title: Hide speed
section.description: Specify the duration of the animation. You can enter a value in milliseconds. 'Slow' = 600ms, 'Fast' = 200ms. To turn animation off, enter 0.

section.title: Show speed
section.description: Specify the duration of the animation. You can enter a value in milliseconds. 'Slow' = 600ms, 'Fast' = 200ms. To turn animation off, enter 0.

section.title: A5Container class padding
section.description: Every control is wrapped in a div with the class of 'a5container'. The padding specified here is the minimum space between adjacent controls. Use CSS syntax to specify padding. e.g. 10px, .1in, etc.

section.title: Local CSS definitions
section.description: Define any local CSS classes.

section.title: Additional Grid styles
section.description: Specify if any other styles (in addition to the primary style for the Tabbed UI component) must be included. Enter a comma delimited list of style names. e.g., GlassOlive,Airport IMPORTANT If any of the Grids shown in the TabbedUI use a different style than the TabbeUI, their styles must be listed here.

section.title: CSS Linked files
section.description: Specify any CSS files that should be linked (in addition to the primary style for the Tabbed UI Component). Enter a comma delimited list of filenames.

section.title: CSS (Font) Icons
section.description: Specify if any CSS Icon libraries should be loaded.

section.title: Javascript Linked files
section.description: Specify any Javascript files that should be linked. Enter a comma delimited list of filenames.

section.title: JavaScript function declarations
section.description: Define JavaScript functions for various client-side events.

section.title: Javascript to run on startup
section.description: Specify any Javascript you want to run when the Tabbed UI component loads. This Javascript will run after the Tabbed UI object has been instantiated.

section.title: Xbasic Linked files
section.description: Specify any Xbasic Function Library files that should be linked. Enter a comma delimited list of filenames. Defining Xbasic functions in a Function Library (that can be shared among multiple components) is an alternative to defining your Xbasic functions in this component (see 'Xbasic functions' on the toolbox).

section.title: Linked resources
section.description: Specify if this component should include CSS defined in any of the child Grid components that this component will open.

section.title: Date format
section.description: Specify the format that the user must use for entering date values. (Applies in the case of Reports that prompt for date or time argument values.) In V11 and above an optional time format can also be specified. The time portion of the format string is separated from the date portion by '&&'.\TIP: You can specify the date format dynamically by setting the format using this session variable: __protected__clientSideDateFormat

section.title: Use legacy date picker
section.description: Specify if you want to use the legacy date picker, or the new date/time picker for V11 or above. If using a V11 style, you cannot use the legacy date picker.

section.title: Language definitions
section.description: Define strings for different languages.

section.title: Text dictionary tags
section.description: Show Text Dictionary tags (...) used in this component.

section.title: Active language
section.description: Specify the active language to use for translatating strings tagged with .. tags. Setting the property here is useful for for testing purposes. In a real application you can set the 'session.__protected__activeLanguage' variable to specify the active language. To select the default language, enter or leave this property blank.

section.title: Remove un-consumed language tags
section.description: Should any language tags that were not replaced (because they were not defined in the Language Definition) be removed from any output sent to the browser?

section.title: Date picker - day names
section.description: Specify the names of the days of the week to be shown when the pop-up date picker is used. First entry in list MUST be Sunday (even if you set the 'first day of week' property to another day). Enter a comma separated list. TIP: You can also set the day names in this special session variable: session.__protected__datePickerDayNames

section.title: Date picker - first day of week
section.description: Specify the first day of the week. 1=Sunday, 2=Monday, etc. IMPORTANT: Regardless of what value you set here, if you customize the day names, the list of day names always starts with the name for Sunday.

section.title: Date picker - month names
section.description: Specify the month names to be shown when the pop-up date picker is used to prompt for argument values. Enter a comma separated list. TIP: You can also set the month names in this special session variable: session.__protected__datePickerMonthNames

section.title: Date picker - 'Today' button text
section.description: Specify the text for the 'Today' button. You can tag the text with .. for automatic language translation.

section.title: Date picker - 'Close' button text
section.description: Specify the text for the 'Close' button. You can tag the text with .. for automatic language translation.

section.title: Date picker - 'OK' button text
section.description: Specify the text for the 'OK' button. You can tag the text with .. for automatic language translation.
